title: Raleigh, rookie Wilson among All-Star starters
content: Mariners catcher Cal Raleigh, MLB's home run leader, and AL League Rookie of the Year candidate Jacob Wilson of the Athletics are among the All-Star Game starters.

title: Sources: Ayton to sign 2-year deal with Lakers
content: Former No. 1 pick Deandre Ayton, who finalized a buyout with the Blazers on Sunday, will sign a two-year deal with the Lakers, sources told ESPN.

title: Luna leads U.S. past Guatemala to Gold Cup final
content: Diego Luna scored twice in the first 15 minutes, and the United States hung on to beat Guatemala 2-1 on Wednesday night to reach its first Concacaf Gold Cup final since 2021.

title: Clark to miss 4th straight game Thu. vs. Aces
content: Indiana Fever star Caitlin Clark will sit out her fourth straight game because of a left groin injury when the team ruled her out of Thursday's matchup against the Las Vegas Aces.

title: Bronny: Not focused on speculation about LeBron
content: While speculation swirls about LeBron James' future, Bronny James is working out with the Lakers' summer league team and was told by his dad "to not worry about it."

title: Red Panda has broken wrist, is out of hospital
content: Red Panda's recovery should take a few months, her agency said the day after she fell off her unicycle and crashed to the court during halftime of the WNBA Commissioner's Cup final.

title: Slumping Mets bump Lindor from leadoff spot
content: Francisco Lindor was dropped from the leadoff spot for the first time in 191 consecutive starts Wednesday night with the New York Mets in a major tailspin.

title: Sabalenka urges Zverev to address mental health
content: Aryna Sabalenka advised Alexander Zverev to address his mental health before such issues "destroy" him, with the world No. 1 pointing to herself as an example of a player who benefited from speaking with a therapist and her family.

title: Introducing the NFL 'Bag' Hall of Fame
content: Which NFL players have negotiated the most profitable contracts over their careers? Bill Barnwell gives his picks.

title: Aces to Dodgers and Cubs? A star closer for Phillies? One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: The deadline is a month away. Could players such as Eugenio Suarez and Emmanuel Clase finish the season on a different team?

title: Ranking the best available NBA free agents after the initial rush
content: Which stars are available? Which teams need them? Kevin Pelton reveals his updated top 10, now including a former MVP.

title: 'Reckless': What league insiders are saying about this stunning set of Bucks moves
content: Damian Lillard waived, Myles Turner to Milwaukee. What do the moves mean for the Bucks, Pacers and the NBA?

title: USMNT’s grit, character are shining at Gold Cup, and that will help at 2026 World Cup
content: This USMNT squad is learning so much about itself -- the biggest thing might be its grace under pressure.

title: Is this the best era yet in women's tennis? Why the depth is truly unprecedented
content: Gauff, Sabalenka and Swiatek are quickly becoming stars, but they are far from the only great players.

title: PGA Tour Power Rankings: Scottie Scheffler and then who comes next?
content: No. 1 is obvious, but who comes after Scheffler in our ranking of the 25 best players on the PGA Tour ahead of the final major of the season?

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: How the Fever rallied past the Lynx to win the WNBA Commissioner's Cup
content: Playing without Caitlin Clark, Indiana had its best defensive effort of 2025 to win the Commissioner's Cup.

title: Added touch: Opportunity knocks for these players in 2025
content: Who will benefit most from teams' vacated touches from last season? Eric Moody discusses the players poised to seize the opportunity.

title: The Mock Draft project: 2025's most wanted fantasy football picks
content: We put our experts through the paces of multiple mock drafts to derive the ultimate average draft positions.

title: Jalen Ramsey and Jonnu Smith for Minkah Fitzpatrick?!? We graded the Steelers-Dolphins blockbuster
content: Do Ramsey and Smith actually elevate Pittsburgh's roster? Did Miami maximize its return with Fitzpatrick? Let's size up the big trade.

title: Is it time to trade away Jacob Misiorowski and Chase Burns?
content: Tristan looks at the old wisdom that "once a hot rookie makes five starts, it's time to send him packing" to see if it's still true.

title: Inside the MLB draft journey for the sons of two former major leaguers
content: They share a home state, have ex-MLB outfielders for dads -- and took two very different paths to the top of the draft.

title: A new kind of mock draft: Our insiders make the picks for all 30 teams -- with trades!
content: Blockbuster trades and high-risk picks. ESPN's experts team up for the mock draft you didn't know you needed.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Switzerland swelters as tournament begins
content: Switzerland's temperatures skyrocketed, while Iceland's fans took center stage. Here's what you need to know from Wednesday's Euro 2025 action.

title: Giroud on LAFC: MLS style of play 'didn't suit me'
content: Veteran striker Olivier Giroud explained his underwhelming spell at LAFC by saying that the style of play in MLS 'didn't necessarily suit me."

title: Colwill warns signings: Chelsea 'for winners only'
content: Levi Colwill has warned Chelsea's new signings that the club is "for winners only" as the Blues prepare to face Palmeiras in Friday's Club World Cup quarter-finals.

title: NWSL to take June break for '26 men's World Cup
content: The NWSL announced on Wednesday that it will not play games next June for the start of the 2026 World Cup, which will be predominantly played in the United States.

title: Courtois: Alexander-Arnold a 'nightmare' for GKs
content: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois is very impressed by Trent Alexander-Arnold's "unbelievable" crossing ability, saying his new teammate is a "nightmare" for goalkeepers.

title: Sources: Valencia offer Arsenal target new deal
content: Valencia has offered Cristhian Mosquera a new contract in an attempt to prevent him from leaving for Arsenal, sources have told ESPN.

title: Sources: Canada's David to sign for Juventus
content: Juventus have agreed a deal to sign Canada international Jonathan David on a free from Lille, sources have told ESPN.

title: Spain coach Tomé upbeat about Bonmatí fitness
content: Spain coach Montse Tomé says she has to rein Aitana Bonmatí in as the midfielder pushes to start Thursday's European Championship opener against Portugal after recovering from viral meningitis.

title: The Club World Cup means little for teams' 2025-26 prospects
content: Some of the world's biggest clubs have been knocked out of the Club World Cup, but that's no reason for their fans to panic about 2025-26.

title: Mbappe's CWC debut was badly needed for Real Madrid, FIFA and the player himself
content: Kylian Mbappe's return for Real Madrid was needed: for him, for his team, and for the Club World Cup itself.

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: After Ilia Topuria's title-winning KO, who's No. 1 now?
content: Does the new lightweight champion leapfrog Islam Makhachev, who vacated the title, in ESPN's latest rankings?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Juventus make move for Sancho
content: Manchester United want £25m from the transfer of Jadon Sancho amid interest in the winger from Juventus. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Barcelona unveil 2025-26 home kit for return to Camp Nou
content: Lamine Yamal and Barcelona will be wearing the club's classic stripes but with a modern twist when they go home to Camp Nou after two years at Montjuïc.

title: What to know ahead of the British Grand Prix at Silverstone
content: Round 12 of the 2025 Formula 1 season is at Silverstone, as it hosts the British Grand Prix and celebrates 75 years of the pinnacle of motorsport.

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder: 3 accused remanded to judicial custody
content: The three were arrested from Madhya Pradesh on the charge of concealing evidence in the murder. On June 26, they had been remanded to police custody for six days

title: 3 Indians abducted in Mali; India asks West African nation to secure their safe release
content: "The incident occurred on July 1, when a group of armed assailants carried out a coordinated attack at the factory premises and forcibly took three Indian nationals as hostages"

title: Triplicane High Road grapples with traffic snarls, crumbling infrastructure
content: Triplicane High Road sees heavy daily activity, but its narrow design and poor infrastructure can’t support the load

title: SHO suspended for beating auto-driver in Bihar’s Sheikhpura
content: Victim allege that the police officer used casteist remarks against him and forced him to lick his own spit; police denied the charges

title: Major chunk of biodegradable waste processed in compost plants in Ernakulam
content: Of the 780 tonnes of biodegradable waste generated a day, around 570 tonnes are being processed at compost plants

title: NDA will form govt. in Bihar with two-thirds majority, says Rajnath
content:
Addressing meeting of the Bihar unit of BJP in Patna, Defence Minister targets RJD for ‘decades
of injustice’ and asserts that only the ruling alliance can bring back the ‘lost glory’ of the State

title: Steps sought to address frequent snarl-ups on Kozhikode-Kannur NH
content: Ambulance operators allege non-compliance with traffic control norms by road construction workers; they also say lane discipline violations by private bus operators worsening the situation

title: Fake cardiologist row: NHRC directs Centre for nationwide verification of cath labs
content: In its report, the NHRC has also flagged ‘serious irregularities’ in the implementation of Ayushman Bharat-Pradhan Mantri Jan Aarogya Yojana

title: Tourism entrepreneurs in Kozhikode on a sticky wicket
content: Bad weather conditions, safety concerns and lack of facilities at ecotourism spots badly affect entrepreneurs who run farmstays and homestays; shoddy condition of roads adds to their woes

title: India now sole govt. with vote in emoji, text standards body Unicode Consortium
content: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology rejoins the Unicode Consortium as a Supporting Member, procuring a seat at the table for India in the text and emoji standardisation body

title: Silence after the Sigachi blast: families wait for missing victims, officials stay mum
content: A 20-year-old had reported for his first day at work on that fateful day while another, just 10 months into the job, was planning to visit his family in Uttar Pradesh in November

title: Air pollution is a greater threat than tobacco, says doctor
content: He said the rise of non-communicable diseases such as cancer, diabetes, and cardiovascular disorders has overtaken communicable diseases as dominant health burden in India, particularly in southern States

title: Operating the Sigachi plant for 35 years without a single incident, says MD
content: Company said an internal safety review has been initiated and Sigachi remains committed to cooperating with all legal, safety, and regulatory audits to strengthen safety norms

title: Six minor girls ‘trapped in horrific conditions’ rescued from orchestra groups in Bihar
content: The rescued girls were trafficked from New Delhi, West Bengal, and Nepal. The operation was carried out based on intelligence provided by Narayani Seva Sansthan, and inputs from the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC)

title: Commuters say recent speed restrictions on west section cause delay in train services
content: The Southern Railway has directed the loco-pilots of the suburban trains operated from Moore Market complex to Arakkonam, via Avadi and Tiruvallur, to maintain a speed of 15 km per hour at 12 places

title: Pune-based hospital performs bilateral lung transplant on Army soldier
content: With approvals from the Zonal Transplant Coordination Centre, a green corridor was established to bring the organs from Dombivli to Pune in under two hours

title: Jammu and Kashmir Police warn action against people circulating content related to ‘removal of flag’ in Srinagar
content: The police directive comes hours after protests broke out over the alleged removal of a banner set up for a Muharram procession in Srinagar’s Saida Kadal area by the J&K Police

title: India not just a partner but co-traveller in Ghana’s development journey: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi said both sides have set a target of doubling the two-way trade in the next five years and that India is not just a partner but a co-traveller in Ghana’s development journey.

title: Maharashtra Assembly members seek revival of live snake worship tradition in Battis Shirala
content: Members of the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly on Wednesday called for the revival of the traditional practice of worshipping live snakes during Nag Panchami in Battis Shirala, Sangli district. The practice was banned by the Bombay High Court in 2002 following concerns raised by wildlife activists.

title: Two arrested in Rayachoti of Andhra Pradesh for suspected terror links
content: Tamil Nadu ATS officials nab the suspects for their alleged involvement in terror cases reported from Tamil Nadu and Karnataka; the duo, reportedly brothers, had been living under aliases in Rayachoti for the past three decades

title: Special cells to reopen cases of militancy victims in J&K
content: The latest initiative will identify perpetrators currently engaged in government service; the affected families can contact the helpline numbers on all working days

title: Parliament's Monsoon session from July 21 to August 21
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju said President Droupadi Murmu has approved the government's proposal to convene the Session from July 21 to August 21.

title: Sivaganga custodial death: Complainant against victim was accused of cheating
content: J.P. Nikitha was among the six accused in a cheating and forgery case dating back to 2011. They had defrauded job-seekers of ₹16 lakh

title: Congress trying to bring ‘anti-secular’ Jamaat-e-Islami into mainstream politics, alleges Kerala BJP leader
content: The Congress was now aligning with the outfit as part of its opportunistic politics, Kerala BJP president Rajeev Chandrasekhar said

title: Axiom-4 trip to the ISS will provide valuable inputs for Gaganyaan mission: ISRO
content: ISRO’s Ax-04 mission provides crucial insights for Gaganyaan, including crew integration, medical and  psychological preparation, and cultural representation in space

title: NDA has broken old image of ‘jungle raj’ in Bihar, says Rajnath Singh
content: He also reminded of Jungle Raj saying that today the resolution of BJP is not only to get power, it is a retaliation for the historical injustice that Bihar has suffered for decades.

title: Three Kanwar Yatra pilgrims die after their truck fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand
content: A group of over 60 pilgrims were going towards Uttarkashi district to set up a Kanwar camp near Gangotri and Yamunotri temples, say police

title: ED files 5th supplementary prosecution complaint in illegal mining case in Jharkhand’s Sahibganj
content: The ED has so far seized and frozen assets including over ₹5.34 Crore in cash, an inland vessel, five industrial stone crushers, multiple vehicles, and bank balances exceeding ₹13.32 Crore.

title: Supreme Court permits M3M real estate developer to swap attached property
content: The move seemed to balance the state’s interest in the strict implementation of the law and allowing business continuity

title: Prada to engage with Kolhapuri chappal artisans, Maharashtra industry body
content: MACCIA proposes joint working group for co-branding initiative; video meeting scheduled for next week

title: SFI, DYFI protest against suspension of Kerala University Registrar
content: They warn of larger protests to counter the threats posed by those who have aligned with the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh. Vice-Chancellor has no legal authority to suspend Registrar

title: COVID-19 vaccination and sudden death among young adults: Baseless claim will hamper vaccinations, says National Institute of Epidemiology Director
content: Research had, in fact, indicated the positive effect of vaccination, the Director of the India Council of Medical Research-National Institute of Epidemiology said

title: Khalistani separatist’s kin in U.K. call for inquest
content: Michael Polak, a lawyer for the deceased’s family, alleged that samples were not tested for potential cancer-inducing agents, according to a report by The Guardian

title: Kolkata Police transfer law college gang rape case from SIT to Detective Department
content: The Kolkata Police have added new sections to the case, including those of kidnapping, causing grievous hurt with a dangerous weapon, and criminal intimidation

title: Samik Bhattacharya is the new West Bengal BJP president
content: The 62-year-old BJP leader is a party loyalist and has been associated with the party for over four decades. The elevation of Mr. Bhattacharya comes ahead of the Assembly polls in West Bengal scheduled in 2026

title: New mechanism to implement job-linked incentive scheme will be perfect: Centre
content: Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya says the scheme will function based on payroll addition in Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation and all employers enrolled under the EPFO will be eligible for the scheme

title: Karnataka Bank says customers have no reason to worry about  deposits
content: We are not in any kind of financial difficulty and we are constantly growing since our beginning, which is unique in the financial sector, says Chairman, Pradeep Kumar Panja

title: New flight service between Kurnool and Vijayawada commences
content: The new service will run three days a week and steps are being taken to run it on a daily basis, says Civil Aviation Minister

title: Chirag Paswan can fill gap in Bahujan leadership: Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) MP Arun Bharti
content: The LJP (RV) is making deliberate attempts to refashion itself from being a Dalit outfit to a Bahujan party. Its MP Arun Bharti said there is “an obvious gap in Bahujan leadership in the Hindi belt”.

title: 11 river sites breached warning levels, says goverment water body
content: Twelve sites in Assam, Bihar, Odisha, Tamil Nadu, and Uttar Pradesh flagged for “above-normal” flood situations, where water levels have crossed the warning threshold but remain below danger levels

title: Centre gives green signal for bike taxis; Rapido hails move
content: New guidelines allow aggregators to charge up to twice the base fare during peak hours as compared to maximum of 1.5 times allowed earlier

title: Sivaganga custodial death: TVK leader Vijay visits Ajith Kumar’s family at their house
content: Mr. Vijay inquired with the family about the assistance provided by the government and assured them of support from his side.

title: Exports from Kerala’s IT sector set to touch ₹1 lakh crore: CM
content: Pinarayi inaugurates new R&D centre set up by Software as a Service provider Zoho Corporation at Neduvathoor in Kottarakara

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Grief in two acts for Kutch family
content: Gujarat family mourns the loss of their son in an Air India crash, who was cremated twice and held final rites after DNA confirmation

title: Rahul Gandhi targets Modi government over shortage of specialised fertilizers from China
content: ‘India imports 80 per cent speciality fertilizers from China, but now they have suddenly stopped supply,’ the Congress leader said, sharing a news report

title: Expert Group on caste survey to submit its report to State government in 10 days
content: Forty-two parameters were used to analyse the caste census report, which collected data from over 3.55 crore residents of Telangana who responded to 74 questions

title: Bike taxis safer, more affordable: Bengaluru woman moves Karnataka HC over ban
content: The petitioner says background checks, police verification, bar on those with past and present criminal cases were among the stringent conditions imposed on riders for operating bike taxis in other States

title: Window frame of Spicejet aircraft dislodges mid-air, no impact on passenger safety: airline
content: SpiceJet reassures passengers after dislodged window frame incident mid-air, emphasising no compromise on safety

title: Rejuvenation of Saduperi irrigation tank near Vellore on fast track
content: At present, more than 15,000 residents in at least eight surrounding villages depend on the tank for water consumption

title: Employment-Linked Incentive Scheme a ploy to transfer public funds to corporates: CPI(M)
content: The party claims the ELI scheme promotes fragile and precarious jobs, subsidising investment cost, production costs, labour costs and statutory liabilities of both domestic and foreign employers from public exchequer

title: Will complete Yettinahole project and supply drinking water in two years to 75 lakh people across nine districts: CM
content: Chief Minister says that of the total 24.1 tmcft needed for the project, 14 tmcft will be used for drinking water purposes

title: Political dispensation expresses dissatisfaction over doctor’s post
content: B. Ekbal says while govt. focussed on building infrastructure and acquiring sophisticated diagnostic devices, similar attention is not given to modernisation of administrative processes

title: Gandhis conspired to usurp Rs 2k crore co: ED in Herald case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has alleged in court that Sonia and Rahul Gandhi conspired to take control of Associated Journals Limited (AJL), valued at Rs 2,000 crore, through Young Indian Pvt Ltd. ED argues that a ₹90 crore loan from Congress to AJL was fraudulently converted into equity, benefiting the Gandhis, who controlled both entities.

title: 3 Indians abducted in Mali: MEA calls it 'deplorable'; seeks urgent action
content: India has expressed grave concern over the abduction of three Indian nationals in Mali, who were employees of Diamond Cement Factory in Kayes. The abduction occurred during a coordinated armed assault on July 1. India has urged the Malian government to ensure the safe and swift release of its citizens, while the Indian embassy is working closely with local authorities.

title: Early days, but Dalai Lama succession potential friction point in Sino-Indian ties
content: The Dalai Lama's succession plan, excluding China, has sparked controversy, with Beijing insisting on adherence to Chinese laws and historical conventions. This contentious issue could strain improving India-China relations, especially with Beijing likely to appoint its own successor.

title: Bihar rolls revision could snatch votes of 'tens of lakhs', INDIA bloc tells EC
content: INDIA bloc leaders met with the Election Commission to express concerns about the timing of Bihar's special intensive revision of the electoral roll, fearing it could disenfranchise many voters, particularly migrants. The opposition parties argued that the revision's guidelines regarding 'ordinarily resident' voters could lead to significant deletion of eligible voters.

title: Leave India...: Foxconn to Chinese staff at Indian iPhone factories; What's Beijing's role in this
content: Apple's iPhone production faces disruption as Foxconn experiences a significant withdrawal of Chinese engineers from its Indian facilities, impacting the ramp-up for iPhone 17 manufacturing. This exodus, influenced by China's efforts to restrict technology transfer and skilled labor exports, threatens Apple's ambitious goals to shift iPhone production to India amidst rising geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts.

title: IND vs ENG: Records galore as Shubman Gill joins Bradman, Sobers in historic feat
content: Shubman Gill etched his name in cricket history, becoming only the second Indian captain to score centuries in both the first and second Tests in England. Following his 147 at Headingley, Gill's unbeaten 114 at Edgbaston led India to 310/5, showcasing exceptional leadership under pressure.

title: In meet with Jaishankar, US def secy seeks completion of pending defence sales
content: During a meeting between S Jaishankar and Pete Hegseth, the US expressed optimism about finalizing pending defence sales to India and enhancing defence industrial cooperation. Both leaders acknowledged concerns regarding aggression in the Asia-Pacific region. Jaishankar also met with Marco Rubio, affirming the robust US-India relationship and discussing collaboration on trade, defence, and other areas.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Gill looked fantastic, very solid' - Ex-coach hails gritty hundred
content: Ravi Shastri lauded Shubman Gill's disciplined century against England, highlighting his improved defence and control. Gill's unbeaten 114, along with a crucial partnership with Ravindra Jadeja, helped India reach 310/5 at stumps on Day 1. Experts emphasise the importance of India capitalising on this foundation to avoid a collapse and aim for a substantial total on Day 2.

title: Microsoft layoffs: Sales head to go on 8 weeks leave; company says will be back with ...
content: Microsoft is set to implement significant layoffs, primarily impacting its sales and marketing division, as part of an ongoing restructuring effort amid substantial AI investments. This move coincides with Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff's planned eight-week sabbatical, scheduled to conclude in September. The layoffs represent the third major workforce reduction this year for the tech giant.

title: Pak: Outcry in Baloch over killing of activist after forced disappearance
content: Outrage has exploded in Pakistan's Balochistan after the killing of activist Zeeshan Ahmed, allegedly by military personnel. Zeeshan, who sought the return of his forcibly disappeared father, was abducted on June 29th and his body was discovered the next day. The Baloch Yakjehti Committee reports Zeeshan's body showed signs of torture, including bullet wounds.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par' box office: Aamir Khan's film sees major drop; mints over Rs 2cr
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par,' released on June 20, 2025, has grossed over Rs 130 crore, demonstrating continued audience interest. The film experienced a significant drop on its thirteenth day, earning approximately Rs 2.75 crore. Despite this dip and upcoming competition from 'Metro In Dino,' Aamir Khan expresses delight at the audience's positive reception to the film's heartwarming story.

title: ChatGPT warning: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman asks users not to trust AI ‘much’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions users against over-reliance on ChatGPT, highlighting its tendency to 'hallucinate' and produce unreliable information. Despite ongoing advancements and new features, Altman acknowledges the technology's limitations and emphasizes the need for transparency. He also reversed his stance on AI hardware, suggesting that current computers are inadequate for an AI-driven world.

title: Axiom-4 one small step in orbit, giant leap for spaceflight & discovery: Isro
content: Following Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's arrival at the ISS, ISRO emphasizes international collaboration in space exploration, drawing parallels with Rakesh Sharma's 1984 mission. The Axiom-4 mission, conceptualized during PM Modi's US visit, will provide crucial data for the Gaganyaan program, focusing on astronaut health and mission safety.

title: Quad condemns Pahalgam attack as 'reprehensible'; seeks action on perpetrators; no group named
content: The Quad nations have jointly denounced the Pahalgam terrorist attack, urging swift justice for the perpetrators and enhanced counterterrorism cooperation. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar emphasized India's right to defend against cross-border terrorism.

title: 'Kannappa' box office: Vishnu Manchu's mythological drama sees a dip; earns Rs 27.5cr
content: Vishnu Manchu's mythological drama 'Kannappa,' featuring star cameos, is experiencing a dip in box office collections after a strong opening. The film earned an estimated Rs 1.15 crore on Wednesday, bringing its total to approximately Rs 27.5 crore. While the Telugu version maintains decent occupancy, the Hindi version shows a more subdued response.

title: WWE star Roman Reigns & Becker celebrates the birth of sixth child ahead of anticipated return
content: Roman Reigns and his wife, Galina Becker, have welcomed their sixth child. This news was confirmed during a Q&A session. Reigns is currently on a break from WWE. He was last seen after WrestleMania 41. Sources hint that he is spending time with his family. A SummerSlam return is likely. WWE is reportedly working on new branding for him.

title: Diddy’s downfall becomes Antonio Brown’s jackpot—NFL star wins $57K betting on trial outcome
content: Antonio Brown, the former NFL player, won a significant amount by betting on Diddy's legal case. He used Kalshi, a prediction market, to wager on the outcomes of Diddy's charges. Brown bet on Diddy being guilty of prostitution but not guilty of sex trafficking or racketeering. This unusual bet turned a small investment into a large payout.

title: Puka Nacua's pregnant girlfriend files for custody, paternity, and pregnancy costs
content: Los Angeles Rams' Puka Nacua faces legal issues. Hallie Aiono, his former partner, filed a petition. She seeks paternity confirmation and full custody of their unborn child. Aiono also wants financial support for pregnancy and legal fees. Nacua has not responded publicly. This situation could become a high-profile legal fight as he returns to Rams camp.

title: Principals of five colleges under Patna university picked by drawing lots
content: In a bizarre turn of events, five Patna University colleges received new principals via a lottery system. This unusual method, implemented to ensure fairness after allegations of corruption, saw individuals like a history teacher from Chapra selected to lead Magadh Mahila College.

title: Trust will pick successor, says Dalai Lama; China says its approval must
content: Ahead of his 90th birthday, the Dalai Lama declared that the institution of the Dalai Lama would persist, with the Gaden Phodrang Trust holding sole authority to recognize his future reincarnation, dismissing China's claims. He clarified that the next Dalai Lama could be of any gender and need not be from Tibet.

title: Diddy denied bail; convicted of prostitution charges; acquitted of sex trafficking
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs was denied bail after being convicted on federal prostitution charges, despite acquittal on sex trafficking and racketeering allegations. Judge Arun Subramanian cited the seriousness of the evidence and a pattern of violence as reasons for keeping Combs in custody. The defense argued against detention, but the prosecution emphasized Combs' wealth, violence, and disregard for the law.

title: Covid jabs not linked to sudden deaths: Centre
content: The Union health ministry refuted claims of a direct link between Covid-19 vaccination and sudden deaths, citing ICMR and AIIMS studies. This response came after Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah suggested a possible connection, prompting the formation of an expert committee to investigate heart attack causes in Hassan district.

title: Judge blocks Trump's asylum ban at Mexico border; says president 'exceeded authority'
content: A federal judge has blocked Donald Trump's asylum ban at the US-Mexico border, determining that the US president overstepped his authority by declaring illegal immigration an emergency. The judge stated that Trump's proclamation, which aimed to prevent migrants from seeking asylum, exceeded executive power limits.

title: Kolkata law student rape case: Campus 'rapist' had eyes on survivor from Day 1
content: A 24-year-old Kolkata law student was allegedly gang-raped on campus after prime suspect Monojit Mishra, obsessed with her since enrollment, planned the assault with co-accused Zaib Ahmed and Pramit Mukherjee due to her repeated rejections. Mishra, a former student leader, reportedly used his influence to lure her, intending to blackmail her with a video recorded during the crime.

title: Insurance co not bound to pay for death of person driving rashly, rules SC
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that insurance companies are not liable to compensate families of drivers who die due to their own reckless actions. This decision came as Justices P S Narasimha and R Mahadevan dismissed a claim by the family of N S Ravisha, who died in a car accident caused by his rash driving.

title: IND vs ENG, 2nd Test: Gill stands tall; India - 310/5 on Day 1
content: Shubman Gill stamps authority with an unbeaten ton on a day when India’s Playing XI hogged a lot of limelight in Edgbaston. The visitors made as many as three changes to their team sheet. While Jasprit Bumrah’s absence also raised eyebrows, it was the obsession with batting depth that was the major talking point.

title: Gunfight erupts in J&K’s Kishtwar; Jaish terrorists believed trapped
content: A gun battle erupted between security forces and terrorists in the Chatroo area of Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Wednesday evening. The exchange of fire continued late into the night, with officials believing two to three Jaish-e-Mohammad militants are trapped. Security forces, acting on intelligence, launched a search operation when the militants opened fire, triggering the encounter.

title: NMC stalls on making med college assessments public
content: Despite orders to disclose medical college assessment reports, the National Medical Commission (NMC) has yet to make these public, citing ongoing legal consultation. This lack of transparency leaves MBBS aspirants unable to verify the infrastructure and faculty claims of medical colleges. The NMC's reluctance contrasts with the previous Medical Council of India's practice of publicizing assessment reports and meeting minutes.

title: BJP MPs walk out of Parliament panel meeting over Medha Patkar's proposed testimony
content: A parliamentary committee session on the land acquisition law was disrupted when BJP MPs objected to social activist Medha Patkar's scheduled testimony. Accusations of Patkar being "anti-national" and stalling development led to a heated exchange between opposition and BJP members. The BJP bloc, holding a majority in attendance, ultimately walked out, prematurely ending the session.

title: Indians are having more protein, and fat, than a decade ago, says govt data
content: India has seen an increase in protein consumption over the past decade, with cereals remaining a primary source. However, fat intake has risen at a faster rate across both rural and urban areas. While protein intake saw a modest rise, consumption of eggs, meat, and fish experienced the most significant growth, offsetting a decline in cereal-based protein.

title: 8-yr vehicle age limit for cab aggregators
content: Uber, Ola, and Rapido face new rules, says the Road Transport Ministry. They can't add vehicles older than eight years and must meet state targets for electric vehicles. Drivers must display licenses and permits clearly. The policy formally includes three-wheelers and bikes, requiring psychological analysis for drivers. Aggregators can't stop drivers from working with multiple platforms, ensuring flexibility.

title: UK shuts both its Afghan resettlement schemes without warning
content: In a controversial move, the UK government has abruptly ended two schemes that provided sanctuary to over 34,000 Afghans, sparking outrage. The closure affects the Afghan Relocations and Assistance Policy (ARAP) and the Afghan Citizens Resettlement Scheme (ACRS). Critics, like Dr. Nooralhaq Nasimi, condemn the decision as discriminatory, highlighting the plight of vulnerable Afghans still in danger.

title: Amarnath Yatra begins amid tight security, devotees undeterred by terror threat
content: Amidst heightened security, the Amarnath Yatra commenced with chants of devotion echoing through Kashmir Valley as the first convoy of pilgrims made its way towards the sacred cave shrine. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha flagged off the 5,892-strong batch from Jammu, expressing hope for a historic pilgrimage despite recent terrorist activities.

title: Quad moves to weaken China's rare-earths grip
content: The Quad nations—India, US, Japan, and Australia—have launched a critical minerals initiative to diversify supply chains and reduce reliance on China, addressing concerns about economic coercion and price manipulation. Foreign ministers from the Quad also voiced concerns over China's actions in the East and South China Seas, opposing any unilateral attempts to alter the status quo.

title: What is Trump’s net worth? Billionaire US President has a big portfolio
content: Donald Trump's net worth is complex to calculate, with estimates potentially reaching $10 billion due to cryptocurrency investments. His wealth includes real estate, stocks, and Truth Social shares. Legal battles and substantial debts, exceeding $640 million, further complicate his financial picture, impacting his overall net worth assessment.

title: Dosa to cake: 'Ready to cook' meals heat up
content: Ready-to-cook meals are experiencing a surge in popularity, doubling in volume over the past two years as 18 million more households embrace the convenience. While ready-to-eat options decline, consumers increasingly favor semi-cooked alternatives that offer a balance of speed and a home-cooked feel.

title: 'No confusion, Shubman is very clear' - Yashasvi Jaiswal
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal supported Shubman Gill's captaincy and team selections after India's strong batting performance on Day 1 of the second Test against England. Gill's unbeaten century, along with Jaiswal's aggressive 87, helped India reach 310 for 5. Jaiswal praised Gill's clarity and batting prowess, highlighting the team's positive batting environment despite Bumrah's absence.

title: Captain fantastic! Shubman Gill joins Virat Kohli, Rahul Dravid in elite list
content: Shubman Gill’s celebration reflected the emotion of the moment. After reaching the three-figure mark, he let out a roar, raised his helmet high in the air, took a bow towards the crowd, and kissed his bat — a sequence that captured the pride, relief, and joy of the achievement.

title: 'PM who travelled the most on taxpayers' money': Mahua targets Modi's five-nation tour
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's recent five-nation tour, questioning its diplomatic achievements and impact on India's global standing. Moitra raised concerns about the failure to isolate Pakistan diplomatically, highlighting instances where Pakistan is being viewed on par with India.

title: PM Modi in Ghana receives warm welcome from President Mahama at airport
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi embarked on a five-nation tour, commencing in Ghana where he was greeted by President John Mahama. His itinerary includes visits to Trinidad and Tobago, Argentina, and Brazil for the BRICS Summit. Modi aims to bolster ties in investment, energy, and trade, marking significant bilateral visits and focusing on collaboration with Global South partners.

title: Mid-air panic: SpiceJet flight's cabin window frame comes loose
content: A SpiceJet flight from Pune to Goa experienced a mid-air incident when a window frame became dislodged, causing passenger concern. The airline clarified that the dislodged component was a non-structural trim piece and did not affect the aircraft's safety or cabin pressure. The frame was reattached after landing, and SpiceJet reaffirmed its commitment to safety standards.

title: Dalai Lama vs China: Reincarnation face-off begins - What it means for Xi Jinping
content: The Dalai Lama has affirmed his reincarnation will continue, challenging China's claim to approve his successor. This declaration, made before his 90th birthday, intensifies the geopolitical struggle over Tibetan autonomy and religious freedom. The Dalai Lama's stance protects Tibetan Buddhism from Chinese manipulation, while China aims to control the reincarnation for political dominance.

title: 9 sixes! Vaibhav Suryavanshi creates history with another explosive knock
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi achieved a milestone. He scored the second-fastest fifty for India in Under-19 ODIs. He reached the landmark in just 20 balls against England. Rishabh Pant holds the record with an 18-ball fifty. Suryavanshi smashed 86 runs with six fours and nine sixes. He has consistently performed well in the series.

title: 61 Missing After Boat Sinks Near Indonesia's Bali: Report
content: At least 61 people were missing after a ferry sank near the popular Indonesian island of Bali late Wednesday night, a local search and rescue agency said.

title: EU Commission Head Von Der Leyen Faces No-Confidence Vote
content: European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen will face a no-confidence vote put forward by far-right MEPs on July 10 -- although it is likely to fail.

title: India, Ghana Sign 4 Pacts To Deepen Ties
content: India and Ghana signed four Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) on Wednesday to strengthen bilateral cooperation in key areas such as culture, health, standardisation, and institutional dialogue.

title: Ahead Of Trump Meeting, Israeli Ministers Urge Netanyahu To Annex West Bank
content: Cabinet ministers in Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's Likud party called on Wednesday for Israel to annex the Israeli-occupied West Bank before the Knesset recesses at the end of the month.

title: 73-Year-Old Noida Lawyer Loses Over Rs 3 Crore In 'Digital Arrest' Scam
content: A 72-year-old lawyer in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddh Nagar was duped of over Rs 3.29 crore after cyber thugs put her under "digital arrest" for several days, police said on Wednesday.

title: South China Sea A Matter Of "Great Concern" To Quad: S Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that the South China Sea was discussed during the Quad Foreign Ministers' Meeting in Washington, as it remains an "issue of great concern" for all four member nations.

title: PM Modi Conferred With Ghana's National Honour
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was on Wednesday conferred with 'The Officer of the Order of the Star of Ghana', the country's national honour, for his "distinguished statesmanship and influential global leadership".

title: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: PM Conferred With Ghana's National Honour
content: LIve Updates: The Prime Minister will visit Argentina, Ghana, Namibia, Brazil, and Trinidad and Tobago. Ghana will be the first stop in the Prime Minister's visit, where he will meet President John Dramani Mahama

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Denied Bail After Prostitution Conviction
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs was denied bail on Wednesday after a trial in which he was convicted on federal prostitution charges but found not guilty of more serious racketeering and sex trafficking crimes.

title: Netanyahu Vows To "Destroy" Hamas Amid Gaza Ceasefire Talks
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin vowed Wednesday to completely eradicate Palestinian militant group Hamas, despite pressure from US Donald Trump for a ceasefire in the war in Gaza.

title: India, Ghana Elevate Ties To Comprehensive Partnership: PM Modi
content: India and Ghana on Wednesday elevated their ties to the level of comprehensive partnership after Prime Minister Narendra Modi held wide-ranging talks with President John Dramani Mahama.

title: Satellite Data Shows Manipur Lost 52,000 Acres Of Forest In 4 Years: Study
content: Manipur lost a staggering 52,000 acres of forest area in just four years between 2021 and 2025, a study by space analytics firm Suhora said.

title: Window Frame Of Goa-Pune SpiceJet Flight Dislodges Mid-Air, Airline Says...
content: A window frame of Spice Jet's aircraft operating its flight to Pune from Goa was found dislodged mid-air but there was no impact on passengers' safety, the airline said on Wednesday.

title: 'May Miss Crores Of Names': Asaduddin Owaisi Over 'Rushed' Bihar Poll Roll Revision
content: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) president Asaduddin Owaisi has expressed scepticism about the Election Commission's plan of Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral roll in poll-bound Bihar.

title: Man Suspected Of Stealing Vegetables, 'Lynched' By Farmers In Tripura
content: A man has allegedly been lynched on suspicion of stealing vegetables from a farm in Tripura's Dhalai district.

title: Telangana Bar Council Cancels 9 Lawyers' Licences For Submitting Fake Documents
content: In a decisive move to uphold the integrity of the legal profession, the Bar Council of Telangana has cancelled the memberships of nine lawyers found to be practicing with fake educational certificates.

title: "I'm Transport Minister": How Illegal Bike Taxi Op Was Exposed In Mumbai
content: Illegal bike taxis are not functional in Mumbai, Transport Minister of Maharashtra Pratap Sarnaik was told by a senior official.

title: 'No Evidence Linking Covid Vaccines To Sudden Deaths': Top Health Official
content: In the backdrop of Chief Minister Siddaramaiah linking heart-related deaths in the state's Hassan district to Covid-19 vaccines, the Union Health Ministry has clarified that there is no evidence of a connection between the two.

title: Odisha Man Stabs Lover To Death In Lodge, Surrenders Before Cops
content: A man allegedly killed his lover after inviting her to a lodge in Odisha's Berhampur town and later surrendered to police, officials said on Wednesday.

title: ICEBlock Creator Compares Tracking US Immigration Agents To Fighting Hitler's Rise
content: Joshua Aaron, the creator of ICEBlock, the app that allows users to track the real time location of Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers across the US, has compared the actions of the agency with "Hitler's rise to power" in Nazi Germany.

title: NHL free agency tracker: A flurry of signings on July 1
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

content: the 2025 coaching carousel is complete, according to ESPN's Shams Charania . the new york Knicks are expected to hire two-time coach of the year Mike Brown . Thibodeau led the franchise to its best stretch of success since the 1990s .

content: the post-spring top 25 is a look at players who could be considered sleepers . our reporters break down the potential sleepers they're keeping tabs on . cnick dawkins offensive linemen naturally get overlooked .

title: From Bill Walsh to Bill Belichick: What happens when a legendary NFL coach moves on to college football?
content: a year into retirement from coaching, a former NBC exec says he would have stayed with the 49ers . he says if he wanted the job, it would have put the franchise on a course that didn't lead to Bill Belichick in 2000 . in doing so, he redirected football history .

title: NHL free agency 2025: Signing grades for Granlund, Boeser, Gavrikov, more

title: João Pedro signs for Chelsea in £60m deal
content: the 23-year-old has signed an eight-year deal at a total of £60 million ($82m) with the club . sources have told ESPN that he prefers a move to the club amid interest from Newcastle . Pedro made the move to English football in 2020, spending three years at Watford .
